page.title: 06Old Bidston.
page.content: During the years{Bidston}has seen a manor house (known as{Bidston {Hall}),a church called{St.Oswalds farms and stone cottages,a{Tithe {barn a Goose green and Toll bar}with house.There is masonry kept in the church belfry suggesting that a church did exist as far back as the 13th century.In the present church a set of {heraldry}is displayed dating back to the 1520's.The church now standing dates mainly to 1855 when the lord, {Robert Vyner}rebuilt it.Life must have been fairly comfortable for between 1777-1807 fourteen deaths are recorded for people aged 85-102!In 1778 and 1779 a number of infants died of smallpox (recorded in the church). The cottage at present at the corner of{School Lane}once an infamous pub named the{"Ring o' Bells"}.This same pub played a small part in
